Description: Tiny ToCS is a forum for high-quality scholarly discourse that challenges researchers to engage with their work in new capacities. Not only does the restricted format require a concise distillation of scholarly results, but the short format will be more accessible to the Computer Science community at large. Tiny ToCS favors accessible, carefully crafted, creative research, and invites submissions both about novel ideas as well as summaries or distillations of existing work.

Items.Title: TinyToCS Volume 1 Chairs' Note
Items.Abstract: TinyToCS shows promise. We are encouraged by these proceedings, and the broader dialogue is only beginning. Stay tuned.

Items.Title: Improving Data Management Applications Using Microtask Platforms
Items.Abstract: Judiciously leveraging microtask platforms can enable more powerful data management applications that are otherwise impossible.

Items.Title: Sorting it All Out with Humans in the Loop
Items.Abstract: When ranking with humans, ratings are cheap and nice. To improve quality, please compare, for a price. Hammertime.
Items.PersonsString: Adam Marcus, Eugene Wu, David Karger, Samuel Madden, Robert Miller
Items.AffiliationsString: MIT CSAIL, MIT CSAIL, MIT CSAIL, MIT CSAIL, MIT CSAIL

Items.Title: Relative Comfort of People with Acting Robots by Theatre and Technology Experience
Items.Abstract: People involved with both theatre & technology are more comfortable with acting robots than just theatre people, but less so than techies.

Items.Title: Bots are Users, Too! Rethinking the Roles of Software Agents in HCI
Items.Abstract: Bots are users of systems just as humans are. HCI practitioners must not forget to design for both bot-computer and human-bot interaction.

Items.Title: Towards an Emergent Semantic Web
Items.Abstract: Inductive fuzzy grassroots ontologies form a basis for computing with words. In time they will allow the Web to merge with the Semantic Web.

Items.Title: Fast Semantic Relatedness: WordNet::Similarity vs Roget's Thesaurus
Items.Abstract: The fastest & best-correlated WordNet MSRs, respectively, take 82 & 182 times longer than Roget's MSR, yet all are statistically equivalent.
Items.AffiliationsString: University of Ottawa, University of Ottawa

Items.Title: ConceptNet 5
Items.Abstract: ConceptNet 5 is released. It's a free semantic network in many languages, enabling reasoning and machine learning about what words mean.
Items.AffiliationsString: MIT Media Lab, MIT Media Lab

Items.Title: Please mind the gap between intra- and inter-chassis parallelism! (and how it can be closed)
Items.Abstract: Existing, easy-to-use distributed programming models are sufficient to enable multiscale parallel computation inside and across machines.
Items.PersonsString: Malte Schwarzkopf, Derek G. Murray, Steven Hand
Items.AffiliationsString: University of Cambridge Computer Laboratory, Microsoft Research Silicon Valley, University of Cambridge Computer Laboratory

Items.Title: Lifting cloud infrastructure service consumers to providers
Items.Abstract: Nested virtualisation is a low-overhead mechanism to partially repurpose leased compute resources. This leads to recursive cloud providers.
Items.AffiliationsString: Technische Universitat Dresden, Universidade Federal de Campina Grande

Items.Title: A Novel Approach for Fault Diagnosis on Computational Grids
Items.Abstract: The automatic tests written during software's development phase can also be used to identify faulty components during its production stage.

Items.Title: Fast Deterministic Single-Linkage 2D-Spatial Cluster Analysis
Items.Abstract: Find the Delaunay triangulation of the points with Sweephull, then Kruskal's MST until the required cluster count is reached. O(n log n).

Items.Title: Beating brute-force: Improved algorithms for finding correlations, and related problems
Items.Abstract: One can find correlated variables in time O(n1.6 ). Similar ideas give faster algorithms for Closest-Pair, and learning juntas/parities.

Items.Title: Persistency for higher-order pseudo-boolean maximization
Items.Abstract: A pseudo-Boolean function is a posiform [1]. Write its maximization as vertex packing. Solve a bipartite problem [3]; et voila: persistency!

Items.Title: The End of an Architectural Era for Analytical Databases
Items.Abstract: Data warehouse systems should be modular, flexible, easy to provision, and support machine learning. It's time to rethink the system design.

Items.Title: Exact and Near-miss Clone Detection in Spreadsheets
Items.Abstract: Clone detection in spreadsheets is useful both to reveal opportunities for improving the spreadsheet and to detect actual errors.

Items.Title: Tastes Great, Less Filling: Low-Impact OLAP MapReduce Queries on High-Performance OLTP Systems
Items.Abstract: OLAP queries executed as MapReduce jobs in an OLTP DBMS achieve same latency as distributed transactions but improve throughput by 20%-50%
Items.PersonsString: Xin Jia, Andrew Pavlo, Stanley Zdonik
Items.AffiliationsString: Brown University, Brown University, Brown University

Items.Title: Is Internet traffic becoming less centralized over time?
Items.Abstract: In 2002, 18 of 10000 ASes controlled 45% of Internet traffic. In 2010, 18 of 35000 controlled 45%. Internet traffic is not decentralizing.

Items.Title: Conceptualizing Transparency on Online Social Networks
Items.Abstract: Sharing decisions on Online Social Networks are reducible to RBAC concepts, making Visual Role Mining applicable to increase transparency.

Items.Title: On the Security of Conference and Journal Submission Sites
Items.Abstract: HotCRP sites should use SSL. It should suffice to add "SSLRequireSSL" to HOTCRPDIR/.htaccess. You might need a valid certificate, too [1].

Items.Title: Inferring Visibility: Who's (Not) Talking to Whom?
Items.Abstract: Most network operators don't know what routes pass through their network. They can find out using statistical inference on observed traffic.
Items.PersonsString: Gonca Gursun, Natali Ruchansky, Evimaria Terzi, Mark Crovella
Items.AffiliationsString: Boston University, Boston University, Boston University, Boston University

Items.Title: Safe Haskell
Items.Abstract: Safe Haskell enforces type safety in Haskell and adds a notion of trust to modules. This allows security to be built at the language level.
Items.PersonsString: David Terei, Simon Marlow, Simon Peyton Jones, David Mazieres
Items.AffiliationsString: Stanford University, Microsoft Research, Microsoft Research, Stanford University

Items.Title: Fake Emulation Environment to Prevent Malware from Executing
Items.Abstract: Faking just enough of common emulation and analysis environments might prevent certain kinds malware from executing their malicious payload.

Items.Title: Secure Programming via Safety Games
Items.Abstract: To write a correct and secure program, one can find a winning Defender strategy for a two-player turn-based safety game.

Items.Title: 33 Bits of Entropy: Myths and Fallacies of "Personally Identifiable Information"
Items.Abstract: Anonymization of rich consumer data is infeasible--people are unique, and any piece of data can help reidentify. 33 bits of entropy will do.

Items.Title: User-Friendly Failure Diagnosis
Items.Abstract: Crash the system every-which-way with failure injection. Build table of error messages. When users hit trouble, look up error msgs in table.

Items.Title: How to aggregate software metrics?
Items.Abstract: When aggregating metrics to assess software maintainability, Gini, Theil, Hoover, and Atkinson strongly correlate.
Items.PersonsString: Bogdan Vasilescu, Alexander Serebrenik, Mark G.J. van den Brand
Items.AffiliationsString: Eindhoven University of Technology, Eindhoven University of Technology, Eindhoven University of Technology

Items.Title: effects of Centralized and Distributed Version Control on Commit Granularity
Items.Abstract: In a study of six CVC and six DVC repositories we found that the median size of code commits in DVC is 38% larger than in CVC.
Items.PersonsString: Jochen Wuttke, Ivan Beschastnikh, Yuriy Brun
Items.AffiliationsString: University of Washington, University of Washington, University of Massachusetts

Items.Title: Portably solving the access(2)/open(2) race
Items.Abstract: access(2)/open(2) file-system races can be prevented by omitting access(2) and using seteuid(2)/setegid(2) before open(2) on a modern OS.

Items.Title: Extending Simultaneous Localization and Mapping to Resource Limited Micro-Aerial Vehicle Swarms
Items.Abstract: Designing hierarchical data structures for map representation key to scaling SLAM algorithms to large swarms of resource-constrained robots

Items.Title: Robots Building With Goop
Items.Abstract: Physical systems have uncertainty. We embrace it and design robust algorithms for robotic construction with continuous, goopy materials.

Items.Title: Impact of Mobility on Link Quality and Packet Loss in Low-Power Radios
Items.Abstract: Continuous broadcast rather than low-power alternatives are most efficient for coordination of a swarm of micro-aerial vehicles

Items.Title: From Peaks to Valleys, Running Up and Down: Fast Permutation Pattern Matching
Items.Abstract: We designed a PPM algorithm with O (1.8run(T)) runtime [2]. This improves both base and exponent. For T with few runs it is especially fast.
Items.AffiliationsString: Vienna University of Technology, Vienna University of Technology

Items.Title: Approximate string matching as an algebraic computation
Items.Abstract: Matching a pattern approximately to every substring in a text = computing in the classical braid group, where crossings are made idempotent.

Items.Title: On finding cross-lingual article pairs
Items.Abstract: Cross-lingual merging of Honduran geotagged Wikipedia articles based on article names and locations alone results in 99.4% correct pairs.

Items.Title: Alice and Bob's Adventures in Barterland
Items.Abstract: Meetings as information exchange mechanisms can be featured, integrated and used as inference engines for solving problems like NLP [1, 2, 3].

Items.Title: Torii-HLMAC: Distributed, Fault-tolerant Data Center Architecture with Multiple Tree-based Addressing and Forwarding
Items.Abstract: Just a few messages exchanged once the architecture is built and done! Have a high-bandwidth, load-balanced data center network forever
Items.AffiliationsString: Universidad de Alcala Madrid, Universidad de Alcala Madrid

Items.Title: Achieving Collision Freedom without Modifying Communication Protocols in Wireless Rechargeable Sensor Networks
Items.Abstract: Control charging patterns to wake up nodes at different time intervals. Now your wireless rechargeable sensor network is collision-free!
Items.PersonsString: Yuanchao Shu, Yuelong Tian, Yu Gu, Jiming Chen
Items.AffiliationsString: Zhejiang University, Zhejiang University, Singapore University of Technology and Design, Zhejiang University

Items.Title: All-path: Finding Simply Fastest Path and Balancing Load by Flooding ARP Packets as Path Probes
Items.Abstract: To select the fastest path in network, start a race of ARP Request replicas at the edge bridge and lock it with first-arrival port learning
Items.AffiliationsString: Universidad de Alcala Madrid, Universidad de Alcala Madrid

Items.Title: Weaker Links for Synchronization
Items.Abstract: Weak links can be a better choice than reliable links for clock synchronization in a wireless sensor network.

Items.Title: Constrained Videogame Content Generation with Answer Set Programming
Items.Abstract: Answer set programming allows the rapid development of tightly-constrained videogame content generators without inventing new algorithms.

Affiliations: Expressive Intelligence Studio and UC Santa Cruz

Items.Title: Simplified Harvest Moon is NP-Complete
Items.Abstract: There exists a trivial bijection from all instances of BKP to all instances of Simplified Harvest Moon (SHM). Therefore, SHM is NP-complete.

Items.Title: Collecting Things Under Time Pressure is Hard
Items.Abstract: 3D games with gravity that require gathering objects to ensure traversing edges within a time-limit can be reduced from the NP-complete CPP.

Items.Title: Google Scholar Metrics h5-index correlated with Impact Factor
Items.Abstract: Google Scholar Metrics h5-index is correlated with Impact Factor ranking some Computer Science conferences close to top-tier journals

Items.Title: Data Publishing Using Nanopublications
Items.Abstract: The nanopublication model incentivizes rapid, citable data dissemination, interoperability, semantic reasoning, and knowledge discovery.
Items.PersonsString: Mark Thompson, Erik Schultes, Marco Roos, Barend Mons

Items.Title: Narrowing the Readability Gap Between Scientific Papers and the World Wide Web
Items.Abstract: Paper references as anchor hyperlinks can improve the readability and, ultimately, increase the entropy of the scientific corpora.

Items.Title: TinyTOCS as an Experimental Laboratory
Items.Abstract: When rethinking academic publishing, don't retrofit a cathedral onto what should be a bazaar [1].

Items.Title: An Upper-Bound on Information Contained Within a Tweet
Items.Abstract: Max bits/tweet? UTF8=31b/chr Can use chrs forbidden by RFC3629 Composing chars count as distinct codepts Max bits is 4339 (-1 for ctrl chrs)

Items.Title: TweeCards: Tweets Go Postal
Items.Abstract: I cn snd postcards 2 all my tweeps! w/photos & QR 2! Prvcy? addr escrow via DHT! @USPS&@Twitter make $$ via ads&estamps. OMG!! #tweecards [1]

Items.Title: The end of TinyToCS is nigh
Items.Abstract: The upper bound for meaningful distinct Tiny ToCS articles, assuming ASCII encoding, is 95140 - just above 7.6 unnonagintillion (10276).
